questions.question: Why is understanding cultural norms vital in business?
answers: To build trust and reduce misunderstandings.
To enforce only one way of working.
questions.correct: To build trust and reduce misunderstandings.

questions.question: What is a common challenge in intercultural meetings?
answers: Same approach to decision-making across cultures.

questions.question: Why is active listening crucial in intercultural settings?
answers: To understand and respect different perspectives.
questions.correct: To understand and respect different perspectives.

questions.question: What is an example of a low-context culture?
Why should one be cautious with humor across cultures?
answers: Humor can be misunderstood or offensive.
questions.correct: Humor can be misunderstood or offensive.

questions.question: What is an effective approach to negotiation in international settings?
Why is understanding hierarchy important in global business?
answers: To respect and adhere to organizational norms.
To assume equal status across cultures.
questions.correct: To respect and adhere to organizational norms.

questions.question: What is the benefit of adapting communication styles?
answers: To foster mutual understanding and collaboration.
questions.correct: To foster mutual understanding and collaboration.

questions.question: Why is patience vital in cross-cultural meetings?
answers: To build trust and understanding over time.
To skip verbal cues and context.
questions.correct: To build trust and understanding over time.

questions.question: What is a common error in intercultural negotiations?
answers: Assuming others share the same norms and values.
questions.correct: Assuming others share the same norms and values.

questions.question: Why is body language significant across cultures?
answers: It conveys respect and understanding beyond words.
It is irrelevant in formal meetings.
questions.correct: It conveys respect and understanding beyond words.

questions.question: What is the role of an interpreter in global meetings?
answers: To bridge language and cultural gaps.
questions.correct: To bridge language and cultural gaps.

questions.question: Why is understanding cultural perceptions of time important?
answers: To manage meetings and deadlines effectively.
questions.correct: To manage meetings and deadlines effectively.

questions.question: What does ‘cultural intelligence’ mean?
answers: The ability to understand and adapt across cultures.
The focus on a single culture.
The ability to memorize words only.
questions.correct: The ability to understand and adapt across cultures.

questions.question: Why is trust vital in intercultural business?
answers: It forms the foundation for successful collaboration.
It is irrelevant for long-term partnerships.
questions.correct: It forms the foundation for successful collaboration.
